title: Food Drive
description: Providing essential food packages to underprivileged families in Multan to combat hunger and promote community care.
content:
Taqdeer-e-Naw proudly launched its inaugural initiative, the Food Drive, on 14th September 2024 in Multan, Punjab. This project was a heartfelt response to the growing issue of food insecurity among underprivileged communities in the region.

The Food Drive aimed to provide immediate relief by distributing thoughtfully prepared food packages to families in need. Each package included essential items such as flour, rice, pulses, sugar, tea, and cooking oil, enough to sustain a family for several days. Through careful planning and community engagement, we were able to serve over 200 families across various neighborhoods in Multan.

Beyond meeting basic needs, the Food Drive was a demonstration of compassion, solidarity, and the power of collective action. Volunteers from diverse backgrounds came together with a shared mission to ensure that no family went to bed hungry. Their dedication and unity transformed a simple act of giving into a meaningful movement of hope.

This project marks the beginning of Taqdeer-e-NawÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂs journey toward sustainable social impact. We are committed to expanding our efforts and launching more initiatives that uplift, empower, and bring dignity to those in need. The Food Drive is not just a project; it is a promise of care, community, and a better tomorrow.

title: Visit to Bait-e-Jamila Orphanage
description: A heartwarming visit to Bait-e-Jamila Orphanage to engage with children, distribute gifts, and share moments of care, joy, and support.
content:
On 28th September 2024, Taqdeer-e-Naw carried out its second community welfare initiative by visiting the Bait-e-Jamila Orphanage in Multan. The goal of this visit was to bring smiles, emotional warmth, and encouragement to the children residing at the orphanage.

Our team spent the day interacting with the children through games, storytelling, and meaningful conversations. To make the experience more special, we distributed gift packs containing toys, school supplies, snacks, and hygiene kits. Each gift was thoughtfully prepared to make the children feel seen, loved, and supported.

The visit wasnÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂt just about givingÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂit was about connecting. Our volunteers created a safe and joyful space where every child felt valued. The bonds formed during those few hours left lasting impressions on both the children and our team.

This project reaffirmed our commitment to supporting vulnerable groups and reminded us of the importance of presence, empathy, and kindness. Taqdeer-e-Naw will continue to stand by those who need us most, one initiative at a time.

title: Plantation Drive at Beaconhouse
description: A green initiative at Beaconhouse School to raise environmental awareness and promote sustainability through student-led tree planting.
location: Beaconhouse School, Main Campus, Multan, Punjab
content:
On 27th October 2024, Taqdeer-e-Naw partnered with Beaconhouse School (Main Campus) in Multan to organize a Plantation Drive, promoting environmental consciousness among students and the broader community.

The event focused on educating students about the importance of trees, climate action, and sustainability. After a brief awareness session, students, teachers, and volunteers came together to plant a variety of native trees within the school premises. Each tree was marked with the name of the student who planted it, giving them a sense of personal connection and responsibility.

This hands-on experience aimed to instill eco-friendly values and inspire young minds to take ownership of their environment. By engaging youth in climate-positive action, Taqdeer-e-Naw hopes to nurture a generation that actively contributes to the well-being of our planet.

The Plantation Drive was a small yet impactful step toward a greener future. It not only beautified the campus but also strengthened our collective commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship.

title: Winter Drive
description: A compassionate winter campaign to distribute jackets and blankets, bringing warmth and relief to those in need across Multan.
content:
On 25th December 2024, Taqdeer-e-Naw launched its Winter Drive in Multan, aiming to support underprivileged individuals during the harsh winter season. The drive focused on providing essential winter items to those who lacked basic protection from the cold.

Our team distributed jackets, sweaters, blankets, and other warm clothing to people living in underserved neighborhoods and on the streets. Special attention was given to the elderly, children, and daily wage workers who are most vulnerable to dropping temperatures.

This initiative was more than just a distributionÃ¢ÂÂit was about spreading warmth, comfort, and care during a time that can be particularly difficult for those with limited resources. Volunteers personally handed out items, engaged with recipients, and ensured each gift was delivered with dignity and compassion.

The Winter Drive brought relief to over 300 individuals and served as a reminder that even small acts of kindness can make a significant difference. Taqdeer-e-Naw remains committed to standing with our communities through every season, sharing not just resourcesÃ¢ÂÂbut humanity.

title: Free Medical Camp at Qadirpur Rawan
description: A free medical camp organized to provide essential healthcare services and checkups to underserved patients in Qadirpur Rawan.
content:
Taqdeer-e-Naw organized a Free Medical Camp in Qadirpur Rawan, Multan, with the aim of delivering accessible healthcare to those who need it most. The camp served as a vital support system for local residents who often face financial and logistical barriers to basic medical care.

A team of dedicated doctors, nurses, and volunteers provided free consultations, health checkups, and basic medicines to hundreds of patients from nearby villages. Common conditions such as high blood pressure, diabetes, and respiratory issues were screened and treated, while more serious cases were referred for further care.

In addition to physical treatment, the camp emphasized health education, hygiene awareness, and preventive care to help individuals maintain long-term well-being. Special care was given to elderly patients and women, ensuring a safe and respectful environment for all.

This initiative proved to be a lifeline for many and showcased Taqdeer-e-Nawâs commitment to holistic community welfare. By bringing healthcare directly to the people, we reaffirmed our belief that health is not a privilege, but a basic human right.

title: Ramadan Ration Drive at Mubarakpur Village
description: A special Ramadan initiative to distribute ration packages to underprivileged families in Mubarakpur Village, bringing ease and blessings in the holy month.
content:
On 2nd March 2025, Taqdeer-e-Naw conducted a Ramadan Ration Drive in Mubarakpur Village, Kabirwala, to support low-income families during the holy month of Ramadan. This project was focused on easing the burden of food insecurity and enabling families to observe Ramadan with dignity and peace.

Our team distributed comprehensive ration packages containing essentials such as flour, rice, lentils, sugar, tea, dates, oil, and other staples used for Sehri and Iftar. Each package was carefully packed to sustain a family throughout the month.

The drive was conducted with compassion, care, and a spirit of togetherness. Volunteers personally delivered packages door-to-door to ensure the aid reached those who needed it most, especially elderly individuals, widows, and large families.

This initiative reflected Taqdeer-e-Naw’s commitment to honoring the values of empathy, charity, and community upliftment during Ramadan. It was not just about giving food, but about sharing the spirit of the month and reminding every family that they are not alone.
